page.title: 04 HOW L'EREE HAS CHANGED
page.content: At one time it was all sand dunes and bunkers. Now there all car parks that have been flattened out. It has walls that people can sit on. It has ice-cream stands that sell ice-creams,drinks and crisps. There is also a{cafe}at which you can have anything from a spade to an ice-cream or salad, from a cold drink to a coffee or{tea in a basket}to take on the beach. Across from the cafe is another cafe which is also a restaurant. Up the road is yet another cafe,but here you can have drinks and {fish and chips},a great delicacy enjoyed by the tourists and locals alike. There is a bus stop by L'Eree beach. There is a road that leads to the causeway to{Lihou Island}.There are also German bunkers on the headland built with concrete,iron and slate. By{Charlotte Gallienne
